Work

  • 2022 - 2024

    San Francisco, CA

    Quantitative Analytics Specialist
    Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.
    As the primary technical contributor of the AI/ML developer relations, I drove a 60% efficiency boost in model development, a 150% increase in tool adoption, and enhanced collaboration with vendors and departments. By creating tech articles, hosting office hours, and improving documentation, I fueled a 150% rise in tool adoption. Strategic coordination cut model time-to-market by 20% and generated $1M in value, elevating our program's visibility company-wide.
    • Data Science
    • Machine Learning
    • AutoML
    • Developer Relations
  • 2022 - 2022

    San Francisco, CA

    Data Management Analyst
    Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.
    A contract position for which I was converted into my full-time role as a Quantitative Analytics Specialist. As I did not change teams, my role and contributions are similar to those listed above.
    • 2021 - 2022

      Remote

      Data Science Intern
      Changing Room, INC.
      I led the development of data mining and ETL pipelines, creating Python programs to scrape over 100,000 fashion brand inventory items and attributes for optimized database storage, resulting in high-quality machine learning training data. Collaborating with model developers and UX engineers, I developed an AI-driven recommendation system, delivered via a Chrome plugin, to promote sustainable purchasing and ethically informed shopping.
      • Python Scripting
      • Web-scraping
      • Relational Database Management
      • PostgreSQL
    • 2020 - 2021

      San Jose, CA

      Data Analyst
      Trackonomy Systems, INC.
      As a member of the manufacturing automation team at a startup company, I collaborated on projects to improve data collection processes and to cut production costs.
      • Developed an innovative computer vision system using OpenCV for pre-production quality testing, reducing material waste and alleviating production bottlenecks.
      • Designed and launched a Python-based GUI on Raspberry Pi devices, enhancing data collection and anomaly detection, significantly improving production efficiency and product quality.
    • 2018 - 2021

      San Diego, CA

      Research Assistant, Honors Thesis
      University of California, San Diego
      Conducted research on cognitive behavioral neuroscience, focusing on experimental design, data analysis, and visualization for thesis projects.
      • Experimental Design

        San Diego, CA

        Sexual Violence and Harassment Graduate Student Representative

        Advocated for graduate student workers in issues related to sexual violence and harassment, promoting reforms to the university's PhD defense procedures to reduce undue power held by faculty advisors, ensuring a safer and more equitable environment that enables students to complete their research programs.

          Remote

          Crisis Counselor
          Crisis Text Line

          Awards

          • 2020
            Norman Henry Anderson Excellence in Research Presentation
            UCSD Psychology Department
            Awarded for excellence in presenting research findings at the departmental research symposium.
          • 2020
            Departmental Honors
            UCSD Psychology Department
            Received honors for outstanding academic and research performance in the department. My thesis investigated the use of drawing as a tool in STEM education to enhance the understanding of abstract concepts that lack a definitive form.
          • 2018
            Chancellor's Undergraduate Research Scholarship
            UCSD Office of the Chancellor
            Granted for exceptional undergraduate research conducted in the Psychiatry department. My thesis project explored the relationship between traumatic life experiences and disordered eating behaviors in young girls who have faced significant lifetime adversity and were incarcerated.

          Projects

          • 2022 - 2023
            Understanding the in-situ Solar Wind Properties with Machine Learning
            Collaborated with the Climate and Space Sciences Engineering department at the University of Michigan to map solar wind in-situ properties to their origin in the sun and to better understand the differences among categories of solar wind caused by their different solar origins.
            • Developed data visualization tools for solar wind properties.
            • Analyzed large datasets to identify patterns and correlations.
          • 2021 - 2022
            Drawing to Learn Abstract Science Concepts
            Developed educational tools and resources to help students understand abstract scientific concepts through drawing and visualization techniques.
            • Created interactive learning modules.
            • Conducted user testing to refine educational tools.
